title: Lethality Jhin is a thing. DuskBlade/Ghostblade changes didn't really change much.
body: Just thought i'd let Riot know.  Jhin still hurts like a mother with these.

replies.body: Never said it didn't. Crit Jhin has always "hurt worse" later in the game. Doesn't stop people from going amor pen though.

> [{quoted}](name=PantherPaws,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NAlhjEfL,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-10-19T01:02:21.066+0000)
>
> Never said it didn't. Crit Jhin has always "hurt worse" later in the game. Doesn't stop people from going amor pen though.

i mean even pros do it and i just dont get why lol

Getting close enough to auto is dangerous. Pros have always liked stuff like sivir/ezreal/ashe/Jhin. They can all provide utility and have ranged poke. Armor pen builds mean your abilities hurt more.

Blue build Ezreal is a good example of making a build revolve around a spell instead of criting with autos.

Woo! more crit. Jhin (which as always been his main thing) and less ghostblade reliant Jhins ^^. I personally went up to at least 70 crit. chance and would always get a {{item:3036}} or {{item:3033}}   if i ever needed armor pen. I never could understand the {{item:3142}} bit aside from some movement speed. but now that the active has been scheduled to be changed...
i still think crit is the best jhin build path idk why or how armor pen became so popular on him
Because people above bronze V sometimes build armor.

I don't disagree but if Riot wants to stop these kinds of builds on him they'll have to change it somehow.

It's mostly the safety of the armor pen build. Your w hurts so much and you dont really have to get close to auto you can just poke from stupid range. Like Varus only better.
good thing armor pen is no more after 6.22
